activities: Ethicon US, LLC (referred to herein as “Ethicon”), receives personal information in various forms relating to personnel including prospective and former employees. These data are transferred from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland to the United States and are used to carry out the company’s human resources functions.  Ethicon receives and maintains from the EU/EEA and/or Switzerland customer business registration information through websites for clinical and marketing purposes.   Ethicon receives personal information about research subjects, patients, investigators and staff, service providers and healthcare professionals all in support of Ethicon's clinical research operations.  The World Customer Quality and Customer Support teams receive personal information from the EU /EEA in the regulatory reporting of complaints and adverse events.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resources, Clinical Operations, Complaint Handling/Adverse Events, Customer Support and Marketing
recoursemech: For HR Data: EU Data Protection Authority (EU DPAs) Panel and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).  We will employ JAMS for Marketing, Complaints, Customer Support and Clinical Data.
